etymologies: Middle English: from Old French tourete, diminutive of tour ‘tower’

definitions: a small tower on top of a larger tower or at the corner of a building or wall, typically of a castle.
shortDefinitions: small tower on top of larger tower or at corner of building or wall

definitions: a low, flat armored gun emplacement, typically one that revolves, in a ship, aircraft, fort, or tank.
a rotating holder for tools, especially on a lathe.
a mollusk with a long, slender, pointed spiral shell, typically brightly colored and living in tropical seas.

notes.text: Family Turitellidae, class Gastropoda: Turitella and other genera

shortDefinitions: mollusk with long, slender, pointed spiral shell
